stand_out:
- Use the data dictionary to understand the meaning of variables in the dataset.
- Use plotting packages like matplotlib and seaborn as necessary to visualize trends in the data.
- Add additional cells to your notebook to organize your code in manageable pieces and make notes on your observations.

rubric_items.passed_description: All missing values have been re-encoded in a consistent way as NaNs.
rubric_items.criteria: Have data values representing missing values been encoded consistently?

rubric_items.passed_description: Columns with a large amount of missing values have been removed from the analysis. Patterns in missing values have been identified between other columns.
rubric_items.criteria: Has the quality of the data been assessed by looking at missing values by columns?

rubric_items.passed_description: The data has been split into two parts based on how much data is missing from each row. The subsets have been compared to see if they are qualitatively different from one another.
rubric_items.criteria: Has the quality of the data been assessed by looking at missing values by rows?

rubric_items.passed_description: Categorical features have been explored and handled based on if they are binary or multi-level.
rubric_items.criteria: Have categorical features been properly processed?

rubric_items.passed_description: Mixed-type features have been explored, resulting in re-engineered features.
rubric_items.criteria: Have mixed-type features been properly processed?

rubric_items.passed_description: Dataset includes all original features with appropriate data types and re-engineered features. Features that are not formatted for further analysis have been excluded.
rubric_items.criteria: Has the dataset been cleaned to include only relevant columns?

rubric_items.passed_description: A function applying pre-processing operations has been created, so that the same steps can be applied to the general and customer demographics alike.
rubric_items.criteria: Has a function performing cleaning operations been created?

rubric_items.passed_description: Feature scaling has been properly applied to the demographics data. Imputation has been performed to remove remaining missing values.
rubric_items.criteria: Has feature scaling been applied to the data?

rubric_items.passed_description: Weights on at least three principal components are used to make inferences on correlations between original features of the data. General meanings are ascribed to principal components where applicable.
rubric_items.criteria: Have relationships between original features been investigated for the data?

rubric_items.passed_description: Principal component analysis has been applied to the data to create transformed features. A variability analysis has been performed to justify a decision on the number of features to retain.
rubric_items.criteria: Have an appropriate number of features been selected following dimensionality reduction?

rubric_items.passed_description: Multiple cluster counts have been tested on the general demographics data, and the average point-centroid distances have been reported. A decision on the number of clusters to use is made and justified.
rubric_items.criteria: Have an appropriate number of clusters been set?

rubric_items.passed_description: Cleaning, feature transformation, dimensionality reduction, and clustering models are applied properly to the customer demographics data.
rubric_items.criteria: Have the customer demographics data been handled in a fashion consistent with the general demographics data?

rubric_items.passed_description: A comparison is made between the general population and customers to identify segments of the population that are central to the sales company's base as well as those that are not.
rubric_items.criteria: What customer segments are popular or unpopular with the mail-order sales company?
